title: Műnster Beef Pie
ingredients: ¾ to 1 pound thinly sliced Műnster cheese
instructions: In a large skillet cook the onion in the oil over moderate heat, stirring, until it is softened and translucent, add the garlic, and cook the mixture, stirring, for 1 minute.  Add the chuck and cook the mixture, stirring and breaking up the lumps, until the chuck is no longer pink.  At this point add the corn, the bell pepper, the raisins, the tomato sauce, the ketchup, the vinegar, and salt and pepper to taste and simmer the mixture, stirring, for 10 minutes, or until it is thickened.  Remove the skillet from the heat and let the mixture cool.

Line the bottom and sides of a deep-dish 9-inch glass pie plate with some of the Műnster, top the Műnster with the meat mixture, smoothing the top, and cover the mixture with the remaining Műnster.  Set the plate in a baking pan, add enough hot water to the pan to reach halfway up the side of the plate, and bake the pie in the middle of a preheated 350° F. oven for 35 minutes.  Let the pie cool on a rack for 20 minutes before serving.
remarks: I made this pie when Erick and Abigail were little and it turned out quite good.  I only left out the raisins.
source: Gastronomie Sans Argent, A Ground Meat Medley, Gourmet Magazine, October 1984.
